wms_article.title: Samsung Heavy nabs $1.54 bn worth of LNG carrier orders in a day

wms_article_body.body: Samsung Heavy Industries said Monday it has secured orders totaling 2.1 trillion won ($1.54 billion) for six liquefied natural gas (LNG) carriers from Oceania-based shipowners in a single day. The Korean shipbuilder signed contracts for four LNG carriers with one Oceania customer on August 15th, 2025, and two additional vessels with another customer on the same day. The company has achieved 49 percent of its annual order target of $9.8 billion with these deals and will deliver the newly ordered LNG carriers sequentially by November 2028. Samsung Heavy has won orders for 7 LNG carriers, 9 shuttle tankers, 2 ethane carriers, 4 crude oil tankers, 2 container vessels, and 1 offshore production facility module in 2025 to date. The company aims to focus on signing contracts for high-margin vessels, leveraging its strong order backlog.
